I4oMNtxbGSjT7NmEF6Ezhw.text: Great Wall is the only place to have dim sum in Phoenix now. We've been coming to Great Wall for dim sum since I was a wee lil girl. Back then, there was another place to go to which I favored more, but is now closed. The food here is decent, but definitely not the best. I'm not sure if its because I've been spoiled by Vegas' dim sum, but everything just didn't have flavor. I think the best way to go is to order take out, that way you don't have to wait for a cart to pass you by just to find out that they don't have the turnip cake you were looking for or the sesame balls. We ordered to go this time since it was easier for everyone to just eat at my Grandma's. It was ready by the time we got there. Overall, the food is ok, but I guess for the only dim sum joint in Phoenix, it's pretty dang great.

VaxvjFdtxvJDBb2PU4GYxA.text: This place USED to be good but now it is horrible. Really, food is bad and service was a zero. Maybe dim sum is still good but skip this place for dinner!!  Pan fried scallops.  0 Shrimp in lobster sauce. 0 Pork slices. 2 Crab puffs  0  Service. 000

bWdmmsAzj7mVH25tRRDm0w.text: Great dim sum for the valley, their sweet bbq pork buns are especially good.  Their shrimp based pieces are all very good as well, especially the one with shrimp, pork, and chive.  We love going with friends, but it's certainly something we treat ourselves to occassionally.

yxRUBvASgdItkdxi-l-MvA.text: Just as many other locals have said, this is one of the best if not the best in the valley for Dim Sum. Having had Dim Sum in many major cities, I don't want to compare them with this place since it simply isn't fair.  This is as authentic as you can get in Phoenix. Judging by how packed this place gets, I would say many people agree. Basic rule of thumb is that if there is a crowd of Asian people waiting outside in the heat to get a table, chances are the place is good and pretty darn authentic. Fyi, be prepared to wait and listen carefully for your ticket number.  I can't begin to describe the dishes as I don't know how to translate them exactly. Dim sum is as much as an experience as it is the food, especially for people new to it. If you're adventurous, just pick whatever looks good to you. If you're more risk-averse, hopefully you know a dim sum chaperon to serve as your culinary sherpa. In case that you don't have a guide, then just stick to anything that looks like a dumpling or bun for starters. Eventually, the deliciousness will drive out the fear of the unknown and you'll be more willing to try other dishes.  Whenever I'm jonesin' for some dim sum in Phoenix, this is the place.

7vj2qu1TYquJVNngd0_Cbw.text: My first dim sum experience.  Ahhhhh.  Can I just say I was intimidated by the massive amount of cars in the parking lot? Jiminy Christmas!  Luckily, the wait wasn't too long before entering the dim sum paradise.  The staff was friendly. Not too good at describing what the food was like, but there's the adventuresome part for ya.   Some standouts: the sesame pastries with the red bean paste and the coconut filling; the pork shui mai, the calamari, and the broccoli.  My most adventurous try? The jellyfish salad. Not gross, but not something I'm inclined to try again.  Yum yum!  I will be back...

qmN2Njl50IW8zMOyZIr7hw.text: Went on a Sunday at 10am and didn't have a hard time getting a table.  It was quite busy as we were leaving, though, so consider going before 11am.  I've done dim sum many times but this was my first experience in the Phoenix area. I won't be going back.  Service was poor.  Food was underwhelming and too greasy.  Didn't see the usual options offered at dim sum.  I'm comparing to dim sum in The Bay Area, so that may not be fair, but the experience just wasn't worth it.

v24WE4WbnIcBtA4jJJXerg.text: DIM SUM!!!!!!! Some days are phenomenal; other days are just mediocre, but the former is what keeps me going back. I started to write out all the things that I would recommend, but I really don't know the English terms. Just eat all the dumplings and you're golden! Oh, and don't forget the "gai mai bao", the golden coconut filled buns that are elongated in shape. You WILL see someone you know here -- if you befriend anyone in the Asian community, that is.  My family comes here regularly for the dinner options as well, but it's pretty average and becomes quite irritating if there's a karaoke wedding reception going on. Consider volume control before 8pm guys!

s8DzJg5Su_Fuy30XUYphew.text: This place is, in my not always so humble opinion, the best Dim Sum in the Valley.  Its best to go early on the weekends so that you get a table quickly. You want to go about 10:30 or 11. The line usually hasn't started forming outside quite yet, but the food carts are really starting to gain their rhythm.  Most everything is great, but do make sure to save a smidge of room for the sweet sesame mochi balls. Not sure what the Chinese name is, but they're the perfect ending to a perfect Sunday tradition

IcGWyVB_1TJv2qHg4hI58g.text: I've been eating here for so many years that I have lived in AZ. It's the spot to go to when I feel like having some dim sum and chinese food, also since the place is 5 minutes from my home ^_^. The waiters there are also very nice and funny.  I have been to other dim sum places in AZ, and I still feel this is the best in AZ. They have the best chicken feet, which is very soft.  Must also try their ba'nh uot w/shrimp. There are weekend where dim sum can be very busy, so gotta come early and take a number if you don't want to wait long.  As for the chinese dishes, I recommend the pepper steak, the meat is very tender and chewy. Their shrimps with cashew are also very good.

_K0zV40LeiwWDag9fzIouA.text: I came here for dim sum on a Thursday at around 1 pm just recently.  Thursdays are not typical days for dim sum and 1 pm is pretty late to start dim sum, so I figured it would not be too busy.  However, I was wrong.  There were a good amount of people either finishing up their meals or coming into have a late lunch.  A good sign, I thought, given the location of this place.  It is located in a small run down strip mall in Phoenix, somewhat "out of the way."  I didn't see much else around besides the strip mall and a Fresh and Easy.   The dim sum was comprable to China King's.   But I think I have a slight preference for China King's dim sum and China King is slightly less expensive in comparison.  Definitely better in quality and freshness compared to Golden Buddha.  I cannot say anything about any of their non dim sum dishes, but they seem to be quite popular for a particular clam dish in a dark brown (perhaps oyster) sauce.  Looking around, many of the diners had ordered this dish and were thoroughly enjoying it.  Maybe an option for my next visit.    All in all, I will say this is one of the best places for dim sum in AZ that I have visited so far, along with China King.

xsJQGRhmaxVX9kkOoMmhZQ.text: Fly in my food, enough said. Only giving them two stars instead of one because their flavors were good. Would've been good had I not seen the fly. -.-

IfXfI3qYK2JAgsec5Wc4CA.text: Decided to do a "Jewish Xmas" ... Chinese food and a movie. Wish we had skipped the Chinese food. First and last time at Great Wall. My Vegetarian Lo Han was simply tasteless. Walked out with a stale taste in my mouth and couldn't wait to find desert or something sweet to clear my palate. The menus are labeled "15% gratuity added" but the server could not seem to clarify if our bill included the gratuity or not. We left a 20% cash tip and paid the bill at the front counter. The proprietor took my bill and cash payment, slipped it into the drawer, and started serving other customers. I had to ask for my change ... and added 'tip left at the table' in case there was some confusion. That was awkward at best and cheating at worst. Will not return.

1NT3-pewsKet66ap4X8oqg.text: Last night was my first time going in to this restaurant and i based on the area it was located in i wasn't sure what the inside would look like. To my surprise once i walked in, the place was pretty nice. It was clean, and the bathroom was exceptionally clean as well. The guy who took my order was a little bit grumpy but he wasn't THAT rude for me to walk out. Once the food was ready, he came outside to get me to let me know, which i thought was pretty kind of him. Now let me begin on the food....... AMAZING I ordered the kung-po chicken and i have to say it has been the best kung po chicken i have ever had.. filled with flavor, seasonings, and taste My mother got the fried tofu and the sauce that came with that was delicious. I am not a fan of tufu, but this one was really good and the sauce made a good combination.  She also ordered an eggplant, i forgot which one it was but it was eggplants in a semi sweet sauce, she had no complains on this either.  I was very pleased with the food, the portion size, and the price.  I will be going back to try their dim sum. overall this place was really good, I don't care too much about the attitudes of the employees, i mean as long as they were'nt obnoxiously rude I think i'd be okay with that.

00FMlsCC6xSAyimzw9JlIw.text: Ate here for the first time last night (take out) at the recommendation of a friend. Most families in the place were Chinese--always a good sign. I had to wait about three times as long as the guy said I would for my food to be ready, which was a bummer, but it was delicious and worth the wait. Looking forward to going back!

K8tOuH3JQq5lMCd0PgD-uw.text: As a Chinese person who grew up in Phoenix, I've been counting on Great Wall to fulfill my dimsum needs for nearly two decades.  I have had numerous dinner parties at this restaurant and never had a bad experience.  Their chinese food is top-notch and so delicious.  As a previous reviewer mentioned, you don't come to a place like this expecting to be wowed by the decor or (sometimes) the service.  It's all about the food!

CzheDeIzV4-E-tBaXqK4eg.text: Great food!!!!!! Ate here for dimsum, the chicken feet are soo good, so delicious. the sauce is very good and they also have other varieties of food as well. will definitely come back again for dimsum

ZTBfkRO4txEtElkrMIF3bg.text: I was having work done on my car at Japanese Automotive, and Don over there recommended the Great Wall for lunch. It wasn't very busy, and we actually didn't even see the restaurant at first. We were finally able to spot it, so we parked and went in. On our way up to the front door, my stepdad noticed that there were no windows, just a great wall ;)  Now, it doesn't exactly look like much, but we had excellent service and the food was very good. We all had iced tea, and I think they were over giving us refills before we could even realize we needed any more. It also looked like they did some fun stuff during busier times, and seemed like it could be more than just a restaurant. I'm sure the regular customers have a great time if anything special and fun happens :)  Also, while the main area of the restaurant looked pretty standard, I was pleasantly surprised when I went to the restroom. I wasn't expecting such a nice restroom there! They must have recently remodeled at least the men's restroom, as I cannot speak about what the women's restroom looks like. :P  Overall, we had a nice lunch and a great experience there. The price was also very good!

k-4DVcevf0o41-a9ZSsStQ.text: Great Dim Sum... Make sure you go early! Otherwise expect a wait.

rXXv98KGhrXOYK9Ok7ceVw.text: The best place to go for dim sum in Phoenix. It's reasonably priced and very good. This big restaurant is PACKED on weekends. My favorites are jung (mixed meats, eggs, and rice wrapped in tea leaves), the sticky rice cakes (look sort of like solid rice pudding), but there's so much that's good.  They also have fabulous authentic Chinese dishes. For a deal, ask for the family menu, or Chinese family menu. We usually go with "B".

O03l06z-XSrBma70a4IBDA.text: 1st visit to Great Wall - a friend who owned a restaurant in Shenzhen took me there - he's fluent in the language; i'm not.  He did the ordering, all I remember is the clams w/black bean sauce was great. Next 10 visits to Great Wall - all for dim sum.  Agreed need to get there before 11:30 on Saturdays and 10AM on Sundays.  But don't go too late; food isn't as good as the morning.  Always need my "stretchy" pants (really don't own stretchy pants).  I always have to eat with a rice bowl; that's how I grew up in our family.  All the dumplings are fantastic, chicken feet is good, BBQ pork buns are great, egg custard, chinese vegetable all great, eggplant with shrimp (be sure it's hot) same with green pepper with shrimp.  Wow, need to go back soon!!!

oAod79gzSx3pHjj_IQFWvg.text: went with my partner and their friends. It's very suitable for family style brunch. And everything tastes pretty great. One caveat is that they don't have xiao long bao :( I still loved their food and unlimited with jasmine tea (which is nothing new)

I-KZV4K9lzT3WtawpEe3ZQ.text: This was the first time since a UYE back in 09 my travels brought me back here. I was surprised I didn't review it the first time. It is a zoo for Dim Sum. Expect to wait for a table unless you get there when they open. With a group of 6 we were able to try many things. You never know which food items will come by your table. As it was we were all stuffed by the time any vegetables came by. I usually get talked in to trying one new thing and this time it was duck tongue. If you get a nice rotation of carts there is something for everybody.

vAAbkYLnMD4_HajwqUtmSg.text: This spot is hit or miss. I've been here numerous times but sometimes it's good and sometimes not. I figured out the food is always good on Saturdays but not Sundays. They must make a huge batch for the weekend and serve what's left on Sundays. I made a mistake on going on Sunday yesterday and I regretted it. The food was semi-cold...hot outside and cold in the middle. The chow fun dim sum had no chewiness and the shumai after sitting on the table to 5 minutes dried out like a jerky. I gave 4 stars because if you're there on certain days, food is awesome...the reason why yesterday's experience won't stop me from going again.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our favorites...

6L4ssO8LuPyjWt2L1GrY8A.text: Due to geographical limitation there are not many Chinese restaurants in Phoenix AZ; other than limited options to choose from finding a good one is not easy to come by either. The restaurant name "Great Wall" sounds old school; even the ambience reflects the age which comes a long way.  The restaurant prepares traditional Cantonese style cuisine with live seafood. Lunch serves dim sum; small dishes similar to tapas. The dim sum is reasonably priced; the food serves in a cart and circulating around the restaurant exhibits to customers to pick of their liking. Even though the food at Great Wall isn't supper good I would say the food is still pretty good. I enjoy their dim dim for lunch and live seafood in the evening. Example the stir fry razor clams in XO sauce, deep fry oysters, lobster salad, steam garlic king crab and coral shrimps in soy sauce, etc. Great Wall Cuisine is one of my favorite Chinese restaurants in Phoenix even though the decor is kind of outdated. I favor the traditional Southern China cuisine. The down side is lunch time is busy and the wait is long; especially during weekends and holidays. The trick is to arrive right after they open for business to avoid a crowd. I like showing up at 10:00 am. Is it too early for lunch? Never... you can enjoy brunch every day not limiting to Sunday only. Rather than having eggs, pancakes and bacons there are different type of selections to experience. This is also a great place to explore culture where you can find tables and tables of families and friends gatherings, which they don't just meet once or twice a year during Thanksgiving or Christmas but happening on daily basis. Enjoy the food and experience; I do recommend this restaurant; bon appetit......!

AS9rTGRVnnojgeSC1KtaJg.text: Awesome Chinese! Pretty authentic, great pricing, within walking distance from campus since I'm a GCU student. It looks a little rough on the outside but its actually prerty nice on the inside.

ZFk0-vr2JUyP1OHHvtdqRQ.text: Best dim sum I ate so far since I came to AZ. Lots of variety of choice. Expect to wait around 15-30 mins to be seated, the place is always pack therefore come early specially on the weekend. I believe they stop serving dim-sum at 3pm everyday, then they will have regular dining. Overall is a great place.

1-9gg7F0G2mUhR5qqiDaZw.text: Always a welcomed weekend treat to share Dim Sum with family and friends. The staff is amazing and always welcoming.

RkmTXeN59n59ye_nrpVgBg.text: I love Chinese food, but the service here was horrible. They were rude and they discriminate their customers. Little do they know I have Chinese too. If you don't look Chinese they won't give you good service. This is the worst experience I've encountered as a customer. Save your money and time and go to a better restaurant.

5Xm96d4xobvUt3E-uYWBqA.text: Moved to Surprise, in January. We have been searching for a dim sum place the whole time. Got a recommendation from the gentleman who does my pedicures. Very pleased with the recommendation. We waited about 25 minutes for a table. As soon as we were seated, the carts started arriving. Everything piping hot and very tasty. Crispy duck, shrimp stuffed eggplant, har gow, baked BBQ buns,   Chinese broccoli, Singapore noodles, chow fun, clams, fried ribs and sticky rice all very good We will be back

T6_cpySdnnC8oPk7Oek8lA.text: Welcomed the moment we walked in.  Ordered Chicken with Chinese Greens and Beef with fried noodles in black bean sauce.  The dishes came separately but quickly.  Good sized portions, average taste.  As we ate, we looked at the tanks of fresh fish awaiting their demise.  The tanks was so full of live tilapia, they couldn't  move.  The chicken dish was good.  The beef dish was a bit disappointing.  Black bean sauce typically makes a dish savory but this one lacked flavor.  I am guessing from previous visits that they excel more in the Seafood department.  Their clams, shrimp and fish dishes have been spot on.    It sure there will be another visit.  We have another place we like better in the Mesa area.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef with fried noodles in black bean sauce.  It looked like a beef pie except the &#34;crust&#34; was made of noodles.
Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken with Chinese greens

AHmx3Pl7l7GpDNNwQK_cQA.text: Like most west valley Asians would say, Great Wall is a staple.  I've been to Great Wall a hundred times for dim sum and banquet-dinners since I was  kid --- heck, maybe even since I was born!   It's hard for me to even imagine how my childhood would be like without Great Wall.  From before their renovations to days before the kitchen fire, Great Wall has always served up delicious food.  As it is the only major Chinese restaurant in the west valley, Great Wall is always busy with a flurry of customers at any given time of day.  They have delicious hot dim sum and they have an even more amazing 10-course dinner.  If you don't understand Chinese customs, this place will always be LOUD!  Chinese people are loud.  We like to hear ourselves talk over other people's voices.  I think it adds to the charm of the restaurant.  ;)  Great Wall specializes in a lot of authentic off-the-menu dishes like duck tongues, fried pork intestines with sweet & sour sauce, fried fish heads with eyeballs the size of golf balls, and all the other stuff probably not palatable to people who didn't grow up around these kinds of foods but it's all reminiscent of  majestic China.  *wistful sigh*  Anyways, Great Wall will always hold a soft spot in my heart.  From sweet karaoke-infused memories to visions of old people dancing to terrible Chinese music.  Cheers!

2EDo6FRs0xNQCSiaKQ5L4w.text: We waited for over an hour just to get seated which really wasn't a big deal. Got seated and the only dim sum we got was the prom bun nobody else came by and frankly I was more than upset. We ended up ordering a few things off of the menu. Kind of a crappy thing since we went there for the dim sum. We did ask about the shrimp and was completely rudely treated. I'll just have to look else where because it's not the first time that we've been treated like we were bothering them when asked a question. Completely over this place.

QQetLoolsXpgUNsKonwJrQ.text: They never seem to have what I want during dim sum. Rude service.... I left a tip on the table and went to pay so I left the tip field blank and the hostess called me out for not leaving a tip!

3iRuWpaq1_oy3WnN8LLQBw.text: I use to like this place however over the years, the foods and services have declined.  Food isn't tasty anymore. Wish there would another place to eat Dim Sum on the west side.  Services is like all Chinese place... terrible.

MWwzuujmb91cZXROYqsCCA.text: There was a 30 minute wait outside on this Sunday afternoon to get in. I grew very excited and super hungry with such anticipation. Four items in, I grew increasingly disappointed. I was not impressed due to the lack of different flavors of the dim sum. Everything taste basically the same and there was not very much variety to the dishes. I felt like I was Forrest Gump because I had shrimp eggrolls, shrimp spring rolls, shrimp wontons, some kind of shrimp and tofu Square, some kind of flat noodle that was wrapped around shrimp, fried shrimp on a sugar cane stick, and then a few other dishes. Boiled spare ribs, a hot bun with BBQ spare rib in it, stir fried noodles with onion, sprouts and Bok Choy? My favorite was the dessert bread that was a little flakey with some sort of sweet gelatin-ish filling and orange colored sugary topping.  The food was all hot and fresh however it was a little weird that every time we wanted something including water, we would have to flag down a waiter almost in an unprofessional way. This meal ran us $18 per person.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dim sum
Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert-yum!

OOlFHiFdOyj2VBXm5TFNbw.text: I've been to this restaurant a few times and the food has been consistently good although it is a bit frustrating when they run out of what I want which is your typical shrimp dim sum and pork dim sum. The wait was about 20 mins for a smaller group but it was 40 when I went with a group of 9 people. Something I dislike about place is that the service isn't that great. My friends and I had trouble ordering what we wanted before and half of the time they would forget our order. This time, no one served us water so my friend had to get up and asked a waitress and he picked up spicy sauce himself while he was it since he probably knew we would have trouble getting it. Even after that, no one refilled our waters or asked if we needed anything else. Besides that, I like the dim sum they serve here.

-Xb66F6KrfRtGxuHcZxgdw.text: You bare greeted by tired people that look like they don't want to work there. The only person who smile were the person whom gave us our seats. Watch out and ask about the dish, because the menu does not tell you anything about what you are ordering. This place feels very low budget. The wok vegetable Chinese green means you only get a plate full of 1 type of vegetable...  Their food was depressing and has now been my worst Chinese restaurant experience so far.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stir fry green is just one green

fPMkKbpiHc_2YCU_nrBW8w.text: Tasty and large portions. We will definitely be back.   Be sure to go early as it is super busy but the ladies working the front know how to move everyone in and out quickly.

juPwhMYD_VnzPPu0QN40uA.text: I've been to Great Wall many if times but this is the first with the new owner. I knew him from another restaurant he used to own. Anyways, I went her for dinner. It wasn't for any old dinner but for a Chinese New Year Banquet. This was a celebration with a 10 course meal. So it was supposed to be special.   We started out with the Assorted Cold Appetizer Platter which included jelly fish, long thin strips of tofu, thinly cut slices of beef and seaweed salad. It was very different but good. You really never get this dish but at banquets.   After this, we had Hangzhou's West Lake Minced Beef soup. It had tiny pieces of grounded beef, tofu, and egg (I think). Very good soup. Then we had Shrimp with Glazed Walnuts that had some shredded carrots on the side. What can I say. Very good. Shrimp, walnuts, and carrots were great. What I really enjoyed was the Fish Fillet with Sugar Peas. The fish was so tender and seasoned perfectly. Wow.   We also had Cantonese-style Deep Fried Crispy Chicken, Cantonese-style Roasted Duck, "Lohan" (monk-style) Sauteed Assorted Vegetables, Baby Bok Choy with Mushrooms (huge mushrooms), Yangzhou-style Fried Rice. The chicken and duck were amazing. It was a whole chicken and duck. Very tasty and very moist. The Lohan had all sort of Chinese vegetables I've never heard of but really good. Really different. The Bok Choy and mushrooms were really good.   To top our meal off, we had Sesame Seed Sweet Rice Balls. You can usually get this at dim sum places. It's a small tiny ball with sesame seeds on it with some black beans inside. Sweet and chewy. Really good.   So this was a banquet with lots of tables which meant the servers were just bringing out dish after dish. You eat a little of each dish and then boom your really full with some really good Chinese food. So if you ever have a chance to go to a Chinese New Years Banquet give it a try cause the food is always outstanding.

GFppudD6X78LJCE6kds1JA.text: Omg the DIM SUM !! So we came here for lunch not realizing that they have Dim Sum everyday until 3pm, and it was amazing!!! Literally everything we tried from the Dim Sum carts was so incredibly tasty. We also ordered from the menu and got Sweet and Sour Chicken and Chicken with Broccoli. The sweet and sour chicken had a perfect crispy texture and the sauce was not too sweet, it was a great balance. And the sauce of the Chicken and Broccoli had such a rich depth of flavor that very few Chinese restaurants are able to achieve. I will be a frequent customer here from now on. Ohh and by the way, don't expect much in the dining room, this is literally a hole in the wall and the dining room could use a makeover. BUT every table gets a fresh table cloth upon cleaning it. Run down doesn't bother me in the least as long as the food is fresh and delicious and they keep the place clean

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and Broccoli and Sweet and Sour Chicken. Both had amazing flavor!
Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dim Sum was amazing!

N7WXv4EgB2vOr-AkikHbUw.text: Dining at this restaurant was quite an experience!  Being my first visit to a Dim Sum restaurant, I was a little bit confused about how it worked...and I still am!  The place was very busy and I was seated promptly.  I was given a menu to look at and then these carts started coming around with different types of dishes on them.  Many of the staff manning the carts didn't speak great English, so I wasn't sure what some of the items were.  I tried several different dishes, each had good flavor and I enjoyed them.  Overall this was a good experience, but certainly not the usual Chinese food dining atmosphere.  One thing to note is that the sweet rolls are out of this world.

TM-aqmLcS-Xo9Rp1F5ighw.text: Fantastic food - be sure to order Honk Kong Style Noodles ( pick desired protein ).  The dim sum is all great.  For dessert?  The flowing sand buns are hot, sweet, and better than almost anywhere else.  Parking is easy, but on Saturdays be sure to get there early.  It fills up fast and by noon the wait can be long. ( but worth it!)  FYI - very kid friendly.  There are nice aquariums filled with fish, lobster, crabs, and clams.

yXRr7SxgVFdIqvLyzymACw.text: Honestly, I've been going here my entire life, most always for family functions.  My family loves their food, and I think it's the best Chinese restaurant in Arizona--its dim sum even stands it own against CA Chinatowns, IMHO.    Oh, the dim sum! Har gaos are usually awesome, ham sui goks (sorry, don't know the English phrase) are perfectly crispy with good balance of salty and sweet.  Only in the past few years have I discovered the wonders of the lao sa bao ("leaky sand bun??")--which is like the bolo bao's more decadent cousin (lao sa bao is the one with the more whitish crust, with a runnier custard).  Dim sum is pretty pricey, though.  I can run up a $40 tab by myself.  For non-dim sum, this place is still pretty good.  Highlights are definitely the walnut shrimp, peking duck (though some vendors elsewhere are marginally better), and the beef stew (this is probably the wrong name again, but it's the beef dish with the tripe/tendons and turnips).    Great Wall was a family hotspot long before the post-fire remodel, so even though the current bathrooms and general cleanliness may not be on par with other (read: Westernized) places, the new bathrooms are waaayyyyy better than they used to be.  I think it's just a general fact that authenticity sometimes comes at the expense of hygiene. (it's still worlds better than some places in Chinatown).    Bottom line: don't let the sketchy neighborhood and exterior dissuade you, it's worth it!  Also, get there early for dim sum, otherwise they'll sell out of the popular items.

nDC3vRtbKV7_K59TWWR5Ew.text: Dim sum!!! yummmmm :) I love dim sum and this place is affordable and the real deal with carts coming around. I love the crispy shrimp ball get there early for that they run out. Free hot tea and open of the tea put for them to top it off with more hot water. I would suggest Chinese broccoli dim sum portion. Hong Kong style beef chow mein the crunchy kind. As well as shrimp dumplings hagow and beef dumplings shu mai. Of course white rice!! I just love dim sum the excitement of seeing whats on their cart.   Lots of parking and a great dining experience for those who haven't experienced dim sum :)  sadly dim sum is only on weekends.  ps the bathroom was surprisingly nice here

jrCPRBQn8KdhyGOCrHZm-g.text: Delicious! Food temperatures were on point. Overall clean. Customer service was good. Try the egg custard tart, the pork bun, and the sesame ball.

xrltqImiVO_zJ7veS1VRJA.text: I've been here plenty of times for the past few years for wedding receptions, dim sum and of course MY wedding reception.  We came here last night for a wedding reception and we LOVE the food here. The seafood appetizer and the seafood soup to start are delicious. The seafood platter includes, Jelly Fish (YUM), Seaweed Salad, Squid and a few other items. It looks a little weird, but it's very tasteful. The soup was GREAT, it had great taste to it. For entrees we had, stir fried crabs (LOVE LOVE LOVE!), a whole roasted chicken, whole roasted duck, stir fry beef and Chinese broccoli, a whole steamed catfish, pork fried rice, and fried quail. Everything was delicious. I never really liked quail, it just looks unappetizing. My husband insisted I try just a little piece cause he said it taste just like chicken so I thought why not try just a small piece. I must admit it did taste like chicken but it was a little too salty for me.   I highly recommend this place if you're looking for some real authentic Chinese food. Dim sum is great as well!

ZN1eE8ahISimVZth2KfeNA.text: Got there at 11am on a Sunday, it was packed to the gills. WOW! I should have listened to Michele M. We ordered shrimp dumplings, roasted pork, bbq steamed buns, turnip cakes, shrimp egg rolls, chicken feet, spare ribs, steam sticky rice with meats, fried tofu, egg tarts, etc... Everything was good. This is the best dim sum you can get in Phoenix.

GfRtU8h9yz5ID7KoqeFKrw.text: One of my all time favorite Chinese restaurants, and once which I used to frequent with great regularity when I worked in the area. Now that I've moved further North in the valley, I miss it dearly but still sporadically get the chance to stop in, and not one single disappointment in all the time I've been going there!   The ambiance is something unique, as it looks like a big banquet hall, not so much like a restaurant, and certainly not what you expect for a typical Chinese place. It's pretty cool that they have the back wall covered in aquariums where you can see the live fish, that much is probably worth the trip if you've never been. There is a feeling that you're somehow stuck in a 1990s hotel ball room, but in some strange way, it almost feels nostalgic more than it turns you off to the place. Maybe that's just me, but it's kind of cool.  I've only ever really sampled from the dim sum, but as stated, I've never been disappointed. The food quality is always top notch and the selection is usually quite good. The lotus wrapped rice is one of my favorites, and it's not a real dim sum lunch at Great Wall unless you try this stuff. While not a fan personally, my Asian companions have always raved about the chicken feet. They taste great, it's just not my thing. The bean curd and pork dishes have always been fantastic, and their several varying dim sum offerings with shrimp are consistently fresh and absolutely delicious. It should go along way to say that as many times as I've been here, I  have never once had a bad food experience, either during or after my visits, nor has anyone I've gone with.   Another thing the do very well here is the tea, it is always a perfect match for the dim sum and works great to clear the pallet and balance out the flavor in the food. My friends and I could spend over an hour just nibbling at our dim sum, sipping tea and enjoying the time away from the office, which is exactly what work week lunch at a good dim sum place is all about!   If you haven't had the experience, I highly recommend checking this place out. Just be aware that they sometimes get packed, especially on the weekend and for late lunch during the week, so go early and avoid the weekends if possible. Dim sum is highly recommended, and don't forget to try the hot tea!

Jb0_8EyxX-Do2JBpextVtA.text: I am a regular dim sum customer ever since the Golden Buddha closed down a while back.  Although it is not at the same level as the best dim sum locations in San Francisco's Chinatown, it is excellent given the fact that it is in Phoenix.  All of the regular food choices like shrimp and beef noodle, steamed pork buns, and pot stickers are all excellent.  The atmosphere is nondescript but then again not too many dim sum places are known for their ambience.  My dings on the place are very minor: their selection is limited in the first hour of opening, and i would like to see lazy susans setup on the bigger tables.  But other than that, they will continue to see me as a customer as long as they maintain the quality of food, affordability, and level of service.

19F0YJJ4W3eGo8GdJl0fzw.text: For dim sum in the north valley of Phoenix, it's the best we have!  Get there early - we were seated (party of 7) immediately at 1020am on a Sunday.  Shortly thereafter, the wait was very long.  Dim sum is very good - some dishes hot and some warm..

cmcjVAebtBzsQg_2UMMA_w.text: The food was decent, but I just didn't like how packed it was for dim sum. It would be nice if the cart came into our section often. So we didn't get much food and variety.

a0Ha3cRaPiSvuiT9Z1F_Zw.text: This place gets very crowded on the weekends: many Asians come here so for me that's a sign the food is authentic. I'm only talking a out the Dim Sum as I haven't tried any of their other offerings. We were 10 at the table so quite a few, but the food carts passed by often enough to keep us all well fed. I have a passion for the Siu Mai and the shrimp, the chicken in banana leaves and the new to me horseradish squares, These are really tasty and not at all 'horseradish-y' so even though I don't like spicy foods these are now a fave of mine. What I also liked is that after finishing our meal we were satiated but not feeling 'heavy', and I did eat quite a lot: you know how it is when you pick from a lot of different plates.....you eat way more than planned !! There are several dim sum plates and baskets we didn't try, so that means we will just 'have' ! to come back again and then again.......

W-UQcvT-rSl6H6nayw-3NQ.text: I've been coming here for years for the dim sum. Overall I think their dim sum is the best in Arizona especially ever since the closing of China Doll years ago. There are other places like Phoenix Palace they might have some better pastry options, but when you're wanting some good old pork shumai and shrimp dumplings which are the crux of dim sum, this is the place to go.

FF4THyGmm572BdyN3yCRIw.text: Go here on a Saturday or Sunday and find this place packed with folks who love dim sum. I personally find it a little better quality, and not quite so crazy-crowded, on Saturdays late morning/noonish. Some of the best shumai (sp?) I've ever tasted......egg custards are yummy......really good shrimp dishes too. Fun little treat every now and then.......never disappoints! Problem is - 2 hours later, I'm starved.  LOL

XaxNRgf0pvYDbO_Yg0oapA.text: Best dim sum in town! They serve dim sum 7 days a week but the best is on the weekends.

PbixxdkTFNfxs9ibqqR2RQ.text: If I had a choice, I would avoid this place.  I have been coming here forever, usually I bring my family, its like a family gathering places, thats just the kind of tradition we have, 'lets meet up for dim sum.'  If I can get it from somewhere else, I would, but all the other dim sum places are on the east side of town, meaning at least a 30 minute drive.    Food:  its ok, looks good, but way too salty and a bit pricey for the quality and quantity Service:  unless you know the boss, you will get cheap rude service most the time, that goes for us too, and we speak their language and are regulars  Prices:   A bit high since they are like 'no competition around, so we charge what we want.'  Be sure to check your pink tickets because they like to over charge, I used my phone to add up all the items first and they somehow got an amount $5 more that what I sum up, they won't give you an explanation either, say its taxes, or thats how much it came out too.  Found hair twice in my food, they did change it for another item of equal.  Don't order their soups, its loaded with MSG.  Kitchen is very dirty too because my aunt and my husband always get a bad stomach follow by multiple runs to the bathroom that day, so drink some milk before going to protect yourself.  That sums it up....if you have no other choice, then take the risk.  Personally I would prefer to eat else where, or even instant noodle at home!

43mepxdPVutYeaU7W2-y8g.text: I went here today to have dim sum with my friend and it was end up uncomfortable. We sit there for 15' and nobody came to ask anythings. After the foods were brought out, we asked 3 waitresses for the sauce and had nothing. Then i asked the waiter again and he brought it w/ unhappy face and through the dish in front of us. We order 5 dishes but they brought out only four. When we finished and checked out, one of them told me we still have shrimp ball is making, and that was 45' after we ordered it. I didnt want it anymore. When i paid i didnt put the tip in my card and he came to our table to check if we put the tip on the table. What the heck? Should i leave the tip for the service we had?

C-fmzcDfhs-1VIp-3wFbRw.text: The guy at the front was rude not friendly at all. I asked if I could not have chicken in my chow mein. He started pointing at me saying no substitutions. I said I'm not trying to substitute just asking you not to throw the children in. Anyways after we got home with the food there was no silverware in with the food.( good thing we were eating at home). Anyways the noodles had a burnt oil taste which made me sick later and the fried rice was mediocre. I've been to better places and treated better for less money. I think I will pass next time. I could have went to panda express and been happier. They don't burn noodles.

u4AZREfoJWz92z88pneFWw.text: I've only been here for dim sum and it's the best I've had in Arizona. Coming from Caifornia where there is a lot of dim sim selection, I was impressed with this place. It's actually better than some places in Oakland chinatown. The dim sum here is flavorful and most importantly FRESH. Came out fully satisfied and full.

ofK9UAk4sibgsQu4oqqKQQ.text: I needed my dim sum fix,  so we tried this place when we were in town.  Food is only Ok! They serve items that everyone expect to have at dim sum, but beyond that, not too  many selection from the carts. I'm  always  dying  for the dessert cart, don't even bother!  The only thing I enjoyed was their egg tart. Service is at Chinese restaurant's standard, which you would know if you have been to "authentic" chinese restaurants before.  I think it's  weird when the lady pushed the cart to us and asked what we wanted without showing what she had in those containers. It's not like we don't know what we want, but sometimes it's a skeptical for us if they don't look good, and we would like to try other special  items that they may have.  Well,  I'm not coming back,  and I'm  not sure I  would recommend this place to friends.

HAP7Kic0woabascnH7AvQQ.text: Went to Great Wall for the first time and while I wasn't that impressed, the food was affordable, average and had a common selection for dim sum.  As a Cantonese, I grew up eating dim sum so I know how dishes are supposed to taste like. This place is good enough if you're itching for some dim sum.  The dishes were fresh when we arrived on a Saturday morning. It does get busier around lunch time. The selection is small but it had most of the popular dishes you might be looking for. The shrimp had a nice texture (very springy and not mushy) and the rice flour dishes (wrapper for dumplings and noodle roll sheets, etc) was fresh too but the texture is bit too thick. Most dishes are lacking a bit of flavor (I'm talking about more than just salt and soy sauce). The only thing I did find disappointing was the pork dumpling (siu mai). They were misshapen and did not have enough mushroom. My favorite item must have been the stuffed eggplants.   Even though I am picky with the dim sum, I will return as this is the most convenient location we've got around Phoenix. Another benefit is it's close to an Asian supermarket so after you dim sum, you can just go next door to pick up your Asian goods.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef noodle roll and egg custard tart. Both were good.

LqdFvVdIWHRHDfXYdV7qKw.text: Almost always full! But people patiently wait for their turn. Never mind if it is difficult to find a server to ask for a napkin or that chili sauce or a soda, we still love going to this dimsum place. That's because the food is already there in carts - hot and ready to be devoured! I love the Steamed Tofu Roll, the Fried Wonton, Fried Stuffed Taro, Ox Tripe, Siomai, Baked Pork Buns, Roasted Duck - I love all their food!

wlxSgH_VjymbUVmV8U7ghw.text: My Chinese friend took us here and while he said it isn't the best dim sum in the world, he was impressed by the selection. He said he hasn't seen certain things at dim sum before.   My favorite was a dessert with mango cream inside. It was topped with coconut and sooo very yummy.   I also liked the shrimp balls a lot.   It is really crowded on a late Sunday morning so be prepared to wait 15-20 minutes.

rIC56iOEZLVuVZ7Z9pzy-w.text: Good dim sum. Be sure to get there early because it gets busy quickly.  A good amount of variety and plenty of choices.  I'm sure it's busy because the quality of the food is top notch.  The decor has room for improvement and could use some updating, but if you can look past that you will be happy with the food.   The service is good considering how many people were dining at lunchtime.

uMEOv8U8rT8YHobvOc1dBg.text: Found the dim sum place on yelp, and thought the place must be worthy to check out with my husband since there are a lot of positive reviews. The food was ok, waited 20 minutes to be seated, service was not good. We were served drink after we have been seated for 20minutes. The butter buns tasted best, and chicken feet tasted weird because it was too sweet. Just my personal opinion. I came from New York and have been tried many good places for decent dim sum, so I would give 3 stars for this place.

puys1cUIpLulML3S56XXpA.text: this food was mediocre at best! I spent way tooooo much for the meal! 4 adults was $67.00

r6QyezzqgqcanV_RTiO_WA.text: Yummy I love dim sum! Definitely worth the wait. Tip- arrive early on weekends because they get busy.

UBr-Y9G5vB0RMxCqYKJy9Q.text: I really enjoy the Dim Sum here, great variety of meats and vegetables. The carts go by the tables non stop for your viewing and ordering.

QJCzo45KQftR7Oidq5ScWg.text: This is probably the best Chinese restaurant in Phoenix. From dimsum to roast duck, everything we ordered was very tasty and fresh.

Muleb6-Uk7p0iZ-7TxcLOw.text: Everything was cold and old. I don't understand why so many ppl waiting in line for terrible overpriced food.

QRwS0wbziWJtwRQyMwQG5A.text: Don't go here if your a white person because they will ignore you. Food was ok but service is the worst! Will not return!

sVlItJZXWJpt4xpPNYfnjg.text: Well paying for an under cooked lobster at $88 dollars didn't sit well with me but I did enjoy the duck n Mongolian beef

yeLbWYiDyS2HrJJQcpN8MA.text: Food was quite mediocre here. Dishes like honey walnut shrimp, vegetable lo mein, crab wontons, and shrimp were all bland.

QSHlNMpQdO4bDhQ6WH44gg.text: Dim sum was good, comparable to that San Francisco.  Dinner was not as good, service was extremely slow and the wait staff was not knowledgeable. We arrived at 630 and it took over 1.5 hours to get all 6 dishes out. Some dishes were salty.

aRhF_vIGVzYent1oXnumxA.text: We come here regularly for dim sum and love it! There's always a great selection, the carts come by regularly and the service is great. You need it, they'll get it. The food is spectacular and we usually get out of there with full bellies for a little over $10 per person. Such a great deal!

1qu4sPhdFuDA6KRD37sNbQ.text: First and last time going to this restaurant.  Bland food and service is completely awful.  Tables around me were complaining to the waiter/waitress that the dim sum cart never came around.  Also, we saw a tables getting their own boxes on the leftovers.   I've eaten dim sum places in many states, but this is one of the worst run and the decor is non-existing.  I would give this restaurant a zero star if possible.

sGb8fNvSISvb4oOR8F1a-Q.text: I've from Hawaii, so I've been to so many dim sum places and I'm really picky about dim sum.   This restaurant has really good dim sum food. Flavor is really good, very tasty. Service is good too. Not like some other Chinese restaurant that waiters may be too pushy to give you food, waiters/waitresses in this restaurant are really nice and friendly.   You don't really have any menus to pick from. You can only take dishes and plants from the carts. So you have to really familiar with dim sum to go there (or go with a friend who knows dim sum).  They have the most common dim sums and dishes in dim sum places. They also have some other stuff that I think Americans will like. For example, fried chicken wings. Some items may not be very healthy for you, but I guess it's fine to eat it once in a while.   Overall, I really like this restaurant. Tasty food, fast service, nice experience. Five Stars. I would definitely go there again!

ovuvs1gjNxWTUzZi3GmPIQ.text: This was absolutely the worst experience I had at a restaurant. Some of the waiters there were extremely rude. And the whole place is pretty ran down with weird stinky smell. We ordered pan seared scallops. A waiter brought a dish over told us it was broccoli scallops. We told him we didn't order that. While we were in the middle of explaining to him, the waiter that took our order jumped in the conversation half way cross the restaurant claimed that the dish full of broccoli and scallops covered in some white sauce was indeed pan seared scallops. I asked him to bring the menu over since they happen to have a dish also called broccoli scallops... He spent another 5 minutes to tell us this is the Chinese style pan seared.   Will never go back to this awful place again. Highly recommend to avoid by all means.

I8sgdXLM_1ZB7vZp--ZeTw.text: According to most of the reviews, this place has a long wait and you NEED to get here early.  I arrived 15 before it opened and even waited 20 min for my party to arrive and we still got sat right away.  The food was good but there wasn't much of a variety of dumplings available.  The service was above average the restaurant seemed clean enough.  The only problem I had was that there wasn't really a variety of food to eat.  As we were leaving (about an hour after it initially opened) I saw more and more different dumplings come out.  My suggestion, come a little later (around noon) and endure the wait for a wider variety of dumplings.

KL1mUzoI9K1Pz_D3IKLvuA.text: NOT BAD BUT NOT THE BEST.  Good dim sum but, after eating at every dim sum place in AZ, this is certainly not the best.  The best dim sum is Phoenix Palace, next to LeeLee on Dobson.  What brought this place down is that the dim sum arrives cold.  The selection is limited to the usual stuff.  They run out of sweets such as Orange Balls.   The 1 hour wait is NOT worth it at all.  Go to Phoenix Palace.  Walk right in.    The staff is very nice and the facility is clean.

fQQbvl-sq7m4jxOXCoEnIw.text: We patronize this restaurant often but last week we ordered chicken fried rice to go. When we got home it was so frustrating that the chicken pieces were as small as the rice and there were no taste at all. This restaurant makes a lot of money with the good food but to get cheap with ingredients is sad. A good chef should always taste their food before sending it out to the public.

lL-7Hx97ujC9mOzON3SVaw.text: I love this place! The food is delicious!! The prices are very fair and the customer service is always on point!

siBSqE0fRa4RErhbGVBfkw.text: Let me start by saying I'm really glad I came here with people who knew what they were doing and could communicate effectively with the staff. Had I come here alone, I think I would have been lost. Anyway, I came with a meetup group of about 10 people. We packed in around the table and ordered tons of different food items. The best items, in my opinion, were the fresh wide noodles with the meat inside, the bok choy, the shu mai, the pork bao and the custard dessert. The bok choy was especially delicious, sauteed in some savory sauce, yet still a little crunchy. The rest of the food was highly fishy and not so awesome. I tried to be adventurous and eat all of the food on the table, so maybe that was my problem. Anyway, I would like to give it another shot, as there were some tasty looking items on others' tables that I would like to try, but it isn't quite at the 4 star level yet in my mind.   PS because of the big group, we had a lot of food for only 8$ each, not bad. I think if you came here with 2 people your bill would be significantly higher.

nUbXJR1UdyMp7Y74cQwIpg.text: Went for a dim sum Sunday brunch and as usual a line out the door to get in. The carts that buzz around with the different offerings make it just that much more authentic. Had the shrimp ha gao and the siu mai dumplings, the bbq pork in large rice noodle, shrimp stuffed eggplant, baked bao bun with bbq pork, and gai lan Chinese vegetable with oyster sauce, all in all very good though the gai lan was barely steamed super crunchy.

iczyte6vRCakd6UqnaC1hA.text: Food was nasty, cold, and old tasting.   Place didn't look all that sanitary, and the bathroom was disgusting.  Only go if you want that third world experience.

5NTmW4brOMLAv0C9kXeFIQ.text: Great dim sum, great prices.  Wish we had one of these back home.  Only complaint would be the wait to get in, and even then it wasn't as bad as we'd expected.

7auzljLXEFCoX-2-eEsaaA.text: THE BEST dim sum in Phoenix in my opinion. And they get 5 stars for being open 365 days a year. They were my saving grace on Christmas Day. And mark my words, my family will never stop coming here. Ever. We've spent birthdays and holidays dim summing here. The sometimes long waits and groups of people gathered outside waiting anxiously to be called is a testament to the quality and authenticity of the restaurant. The weekday dim sum options aren't as vast and great as the weekend but dim sum is really a good idea any day of the week for lunch before it ends at 2 pm. I can't speak for their regular menu because I've never had it but I wouldn't hesitate to try anything family style. Everything is so good. Please don't ever close down!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The usual dim sum spread :)
Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Taho&#34; or soybean tofu dessert with sweet ginger sauce. THE BEST

-iPmHpif8-To2BfHqVEDvg.text: Dim sum is a family tradition whenever my parents are in town. We usually frequent Golden Buddha for this, but it is no longer available.  Although, the ambiance is not as transcendent to Golden Buddha, the food was in my opinion..better.   Very authentic, and lots of  carts to choose from. The best pork buns, sticky rice wrapped in traditional banana leaves, crispy shrimp egg rolls, congee with thousand years egg...I didn't care for the egg too much as it was very over powering, however if you like that sort of egg richness then give it a try. Even though I didn't care for that part of the soup, I still finished my bowl! The tarrot root cake was my favorite part. Try the shu mai with the vinegar sauce...and oh my goodness the ROASTED PORK WAS TO DIE FOR!!  They even let you take home the leftovers.   Our table was not ready when we got to it, a couple of spoons were not cleaned well and we never got any water with our meal. The service is probably my only complaint.    It was a good half hour or so wait, which to me is a good sign. Full sized families were entering and exiting and to me, once again a good sign.

84rBGmPjPqfB_dpWxr80OA.text: Amazing! As a New Yorker used to the best we were so happily impressed and service was great but the food was the best part. Every dish was cooked to perfection it was like eating in china town. We are already planning coming back and what we can take home. Don't hesitate to take a chance on Sat or Sunday dim sum-this is the place.

m4L3O2lfr8ZdpD7rYYcPhA.text: We love coming here for dim sum! Everything is amazing! Perfect place to celebrate any occasion!

kveqqg7glsXk-klTdKO53g.text: Dimsum is pretty good on Sunday.  They don't have everything, but what they have is good.  Especially like the donuts after the meal.

9fgA-mEnmxuT3fTKummTlA.text: Dimsum was decent. got there job done. I like Phoenix palace a lot better in Mesa. The one dessert I ordered, white almond jelly with fruit was terrible. Saves yourself and do not order. Other than that, order away!

pJzmfego4xuF83sXvQpTiw.text: The only time I really ever eat here is for a wedding reception or dim sum.  We came for dinner last week and ordered: baked tilapia (pulled from the tank), chicken, mayonnaise shrimp, salt & pepper shrimp, peking pork, house fried rice and seafood soup.  Everything came out quickly but the food was nothing to write home about.  The chicken was so plain and extremely dry.  The house fried rice was tasty but also pretty dry.  Seafood soup - where was the seafood???  The peking pork was my favorite - flavorful.  The fish was also tasteless.  Did they just pull the fish from the tank and bake it and add no seasonings?    I would suggest coming here for dim sum but for a regular night of dinner? Probably not.

HT_d_uQijwOuIsSQifWJ8w.text: We have been looking for legit Chinese Dim Sum for 3 years since moving to AZ from San Francisco.  We should that it has been a very disappointing search, until today!!!  This place is authentic to the bone!  The staff speaks exceptional English for this type of establishment...  the food was incredible: shrimp/pork dumplings, pork ribs, BBQ pork slices, beef chow fun with gravy...  and the tea was remarkable!  The staff was friendly, helping and even funny!  We will DEFINITELY  be coming back again!!!  If you are in the Phoenix area and starving for authentic and legit Chinese food, this is the place to try!!!  Don't be like us and waste three years of life looking!!!

aoQ_2lxx4aoCmARcP8Zgpg.text: Smells like an Asian grocery store in here! Feels good man. Check out the fish tanks in the back--I like to know my seafood was freshly beheaded mere minutes before landing on my plate.  So far, I've sampled the dim sum. Pork shu mai all day--it's legit! Perfectly marinated pork AND heavily spiced shrimp...when I return, I'll try my best to try something different. Like chicken feet.  This is really what authentic Chinese looks like, and I'm happy to have found it. I'll be back for more treats from the Far East...and the full bar!

FNgayUTiM4aCIoyDbfXjCg.text: This is the worst dim sum place I every eaten .Everytime I go to Great Wall my stomach hurts.There manner are the worst.

XiXuBB4VWM5j5BCYXTMzGw.text: I love this place!! Great tasting food and very fast service. We go all the time but only during dim sum and they get you the food the moment you sit love the quick service. And the food always tastes amazing!!! You must try it!!!

PpIsF1zc-iEixTgUuvjTyA.text: Food is alright, but Serivce is horrible! I went there with my family. After we Seated down for like 10min no server come up to take beverage ordered. All the server just standing there and hangout. We told one female waitress we need hot tea and she was rude answered "just wait ". Rude rude rude, actually I don't know why a lot of time they were just look like mad.no smiles.no hi no bye !

w2N51R633rdXAAMm5jxB9A.text: Best dim sum in the valley- hands down! We are regulars and the staff is alway happy and ready to serve. Food is great! Get there early on the weekends before 10am otherwise you will have to WAIT and they will run out out of the good stuff by 12.

uj7uwyTr2sxE8y2B_qTywA.text: This was by far the worst restaurant I've ever been too pertaining to customer service. I went in at 2 and asked for baked coconut bread and Banh Bow. I called an hour earlier and they said they stopped serving it at 3 so I came in at 2. They come back 15 minutes after I've ordered and said they aren't serving it anymore. I then see a Vietnamese couple get their order Banh Bow even though they walked in after us. I ask why they got their order and they said they ordered before us knowing for sure I ordered and came in before them. They are borderline racist if you are not Vietnamese and have the worst customer service I've ever experienced. Would not recommend to anyone.

jZHvD8I7_T-RYr614sxerA.text: Great Wall provides a large menu and a clean dining room with a lot of seating. There are two sections for seating in the Dim Sum area. I was ordering off the lunch menu and chose to sit separately. The menu provides a lot large selection of typical Chinese food. I didn't see a General Tso (my favorite) option on the lunch menu, but I went with Sesame Chicken.  The lunch special was $5.50 and included an egg flower soup, egg roll with mustard and sweet & sour dipping sauces, rice, and a good portion of chicken. It was crisp and had a good flavor, but was a little bit salty.   A server came by with a cart asking if I wanted dessert. There were several options available, but I did not select any (I wasn't sure if it was included or extra, so I passed).  All in all, Great Wall was a good and low-priced, good service option for a Chinese food. The staff was fast and friendly. With most restaurants in the area being Mexican, this is a good place to get quick Chinese.

OZabl29MTfAdcai5tPd4YQ.text: Surprisingly good. Absolutely awesome for their hours.  Phoenix doesn't have very many Chinese places open late on weeknights,  so this place is a find

Hrw8M6o-1xFFTbV3ShfaYw.text: You can't go wrong at this place. Best Chinese food here, before I was a vegetarian.  you come here, you're obligated to see someone you know and their grandmas. Haha.  When there's a long wait, we go next door to the nail supply. lolz . To kill time.  Fried tofu is the bestttt

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My veggie dishes

Mubp3KRTUxmLvC2bMjNeCQ.text: Place is straight! Dim sum is pretty good, chicken feet are meaty, you food is swimming around, alive, in the restaurant, screams fresh. Best thing is they have dim sum every day if you are just craving it.

ngNXxdAP95Xjjg47T8TDCg.text: I did not really like the Dim Sum. I would try the regular Lunch menu. I would go back again.

jr8-txFYUmTkygwrrVINyw.text: This is by far the best Dim Sum in the valley.  The seafood was fresh. Everything was great.  Walked in, there was a line, but it only took 10 mins to get seated. Granted, going on a Sunday at noon for Dim Sum  is probably the busiest time to go. We ate so much food we needed to be wheeled out of there.  A must "go to".

8k2WpYJFfsPL3kupmvGjWA.text: Best place for dim sum in the valley.  Prefer this one to the one at Mekong Plaza in Mesa.  Pork siomai is the family favorite. Calamari is the bomb, when the cook isn't in (he gets in about 10-11am on weekends), we get the Salt and Pepper squid from the a la carte menu. Shrimp egg rolls, mmmmmmm.

TDTt-yytDw_otAVFcxOUKg.text: Great  Chinese food for Phoenix area but the service sucks. They literally just toss your order on the table and push the other plates to make room. No manners at all when they reach over your face. They don't smile. Nothing at all. No customer service at all. But hey their food is good so I guess that's all they care about.

Re2sko5-pU2HyPtXDnokZw.text: We went today, there were 4 of us for lunch. It took 10 min to seat us, the host was extremely rude! Place only had 12 people in it. We sat down for Dim Sum and they only brought 1 cart in 20 min to the table. We never got water refills and just kept waiting and waiting for another 15 min for more food. It never happened. We kept asking different staff members, and they said check with your waiter. Finally we just walked out!

Jn-vQXZ9Ft65L6Mh1-RN8A.text: Food is great, my family and I have been going to Great Wall Cuisine for over 20 years.

VuaxbMJEpvOlrtI3WIQJsQ.text: The best shiu mai and chicken dimsum i've tasted in phoenix.it's the best chinese restaurant i've been to.i was just a bit disappointed bcoz i'm cravibg for a congee but it's only available on weekends (that's why i gave a 4 star only)they have a happy hour for dimsums which made me come back over and over again

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1tatxC6_ivyoEuWJWeXVeQ.text: Dim Sum fans look no further! (unless you live on the other side of town, like me).  My office used to love the Golden Buddha at the COFCO Center. When it closed, our monthly cravings for Dim Sum went unsatisfied until we heard about this spot. The parking lot is worn down and the location is not close to us. Upon entry, we noticed the clientele matched the cuisine - always a good sign! The seating is much like an adapted ballroom. It looks like they may hold wedding receptions or small events there.   The Dim Sum cart came around, and to our joyous surprise, the waitress was one of our old friends from the Golden Buddha!! And, the Dim Sum must have come with her. The pork and shrimp dumplings were very tender and tasty. Careful, though, they're piping hot. The seasame and meat-balls were also good along with the shrimp egg rolls (come in sets of 3). Wash it all down with some hot tea and you're in for an excellent, authentic tasting Chinese lunch.

g4jcJOgD0lHc6cyd5lBL8w.text: Our go to for dim sum! Always a crowd on the weekend but definitely worth the wait. We come all the way from north Scottsdale. I think the best time to come on a Sunday would be around 11am for food selection but you will be waiting for a table. Trust me it's worth the wait. The staff is friendly and quick. Will remain one of faves for that Sunday hangover fix !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The footballs that bring me life

imohCSNMTZUlEEioRJq43Q.text: Eating at Great Wall is a regular routine we do on the weekend with my family, however something that happened today disturbs me. In that more and more non Asians are eating at this establishment I'm wondering if anyone else discovered a price discrepancy from their tickets where they seem to practice charging more. If they have a policy of charging for gratuities on top of food depending on number of the party. It is not mentioned where I noticed. There was three of us and I discovered this after trying to teach my child about adding and knowing how we spend our money. I caught the lady from overcharging and she gave me a lame excuse. I'm a little sad when I see inconsistency in quality and service.   After 4 months I decided to come back and give it another chance but still they practice to deceive their customers. I guess now I've learned.

RKqE6SR-WN73HzQ59O0d7A.text: The food is great and it hets you full so easily, but the service is really bad, the waiters were really rude and were really into conversations. If you like food and don't care about waiters, I recommend eating here. But if you depend on waiters, it is better going somewhere else. This restaurant has a really convincing atmosphere and the food is great. You can buy fresh fish and shellfish straight from the water. Great place, but the service needs to improve.

JJw1v-42GFJlB3PElH69cw.text: The dim sum is excellent and always fresh. My favorite dim sum restaurant in Phoenix!!! Very friendly servers and helpful!

wG7Vxo6IutJVIH2h-pQvlw.text: Great place for lunch and great dim-sum. This place is clean and the food is tasty. Love their Singapore Noodles and Chinese Broccoli.

6dNYDO3eM8qCx-r5zNksCQ.text: Asian guy declares this as a Legit dim sum establishment! After eating dim sum in most major cities in the US, Canada and Hong Kong: this LA resident (also the home of excellent dim sum) was happy to find a legit dim sum place in AZ! Food quality was very good and the service was traditionally Asian as well which means for any non Asians, mediocre to poor service rating! Lol  I have had worst quality in Orange County California and this place had a few items that many places in Cali do not carry. Recommended for the dim sum and reminder the service is traditional Asian!

FDpjbM2ecv-f2fb-m65Bqg.text: A pretty decent place. However, I'm giving it only 3 stars because during dim sum, a waiter was serving a bowl of tripe to a nearby diner, and I could see the juice dripping through his fingers and back into the container as he held it. That was gross to watch. Even if he washed his hands, he's pushing a cart around. They should consider getting bowls with handles or try not to over fill them. I wanted tripe, and that action made me skip it.

uOYVOVA6hBPXx4V0AN4nGQ.text: Some colleagues and I made the drive all the way to the other side of town for lunch one day to try their Dim Sum.  They were in an AZ Central article listing them as one of the best Dim Sum restaurants in the Valley.  We tried a variety of items and I'm not sure exactly what it was...we just ordered what looked good.  I tried a Pork Dumpling, a BBQ Pork stuffed puffy thing, Spicy Beef and Veggies, and a puffy thing stuffed with I think Beans.  The food was OK, not as great as the AZ Central article.  I was expecting food as good as Ping Pang Pong in Vegas when I read the accolades.  I think I over-hyped it in my mind before our visit.  The restaurant is located in a sketchy neighborhood.  I wouldn't come back at night, that's for sure.  Return Factor - 20%

0fmXh3lI9o-pPXetiQJDVw.text: The food here was wonderful, I love the atmosphere and the layout of the restaurant. There is loads of space to accommodate many people. The dim sum is one of the best places I've had in phoenix. I would recommend this place to those who enjoy Dim Sum.

dFgFdrRRuGYsNi_bLaMt8w.text: Came here on Saturday. The place was busy the service was very slow. It takes about 1 hr to get a shumai because their waitress had no common sense to come back to the table where they ran out of things. She kept starting her run at the same table. The waitress was extremely rude. I hope the owner rot in hell.

TPs2kDBCp5s3Ys-wJu_t8A.text: It's been hard to find a Dim Sum restaurant here and we traveled 40 miles to try this one. Coming from the Bay Area they are everywhere and standard very high, as are the prices so I've been missing dim sum. This was a treat to find an authentic restaurant. Servers were friendly and prices good.  We'll come back and try it again.

uhN44z3Y0w0RppVJBbPirg.text: Lived in San Francisco for many years so I know Dim Sum. I kept my expectations realistic, but this place went to a new low. Waited 45-55 min but don't mind if the food is good. Once seated only one cart comes around with food and the only reason that came around was the waitress said she had completed her circuit of the room and basically these are the leftovers.  When you enter the restaurant I suggest if you come here sit in the middle or to the left of the room. They do not circulate toward the right.  People next to me never saw a cart and had to order off the menu. I brought this to the attention to a working staff member and he said there is nothing he can do about When asked to talk to a manager there was no one one duty. They also ran out of food and we were here at a reasonable time. They stop serving Dim Sum at 3. But in our case it stopped at 2. Did not see any carts with any new food. If it weren't for the left orders we at we would have not eaten at all. Such bad service and a hurry up in and out attitude. I will never come here again. My search for good Dim Sum and good service continues. The restrooms are disgustingly dirty. Not sure it it was water or urine all over the floor near the urinals but it needed mopping.  It did not smell good at all. Oh yea one last thing!  Who charges for refills of soft drinks these days. 'New low'

QRvsjz2H2GdKO1tiVHtfIA.text: What an amazing experience! We will FOR SURE be back. Get the BBQ pork buns and the soy sauce noodles. Yum!   We were a little confused for the first 5 minutes, but a couple waiters helped us out and overall we figured out how it worked after a few rounds.   Tip: if you see others confused. Please explain the process to them. Another table asked us while we were leaving and we were happy to help and explain , because it was WORTH it.   The location is in, what looks like a little strip mall, don't let the location fool you. Great food!   Can't wait for our next visit!

rzgNwl4PHiiKGMOqGSEI_Q.text: I've only been here twice and the experience was not so great. The first time I was here, I had a great time but they have problems getting the orders right. I had ordered a chow mein with no vegetables and it came out full of vegetables. Also their receipt is in Chinese so we can't really check if the had the right items. The service was great, the waiter we had was funny and energetic.  The second time I was here, my expectations for this place has dropped. We came in on a busy day and the service was whack! We didn't know who our waiter was and we waited half an hour for food to come. There were 5 of us and only one person got drinks while the other 4 just sat there without drinks and our food came.  This place is great on a regular day but on a busy day it becomes a disaster. One recommendation for this place is to get waiters that knows how to speak English. It's really hard to order and ask for stuff if they can't understand what you are saying.

hKikEf4TGFAcK68Clu1hIg.text: Havent been here for dim sum for at least 5 yrs and decided to come back to switch it up a little since weve been only going to Mekong Plaza and Phoenix Palace. Food was very fresh and most items i wanted were available on the carts, although i did have to ask for a few things.

qhFSiWQYh9S9ECKT4BAAQg.text: I finally have a chance to try this Dim Sum place during Thanksgiving and I have to say that the foods are delicious and the service was great compare to many other Dim Sum place I've been to, however the place is a little unsanitary. I was very disappointed with that but overall taste of the food I'd give 5 stars but one star out for uncleanliness :(

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vzgLoLW7eiq6sCe9yYU7xg.text: Of course this is our go to for dim sum. Parking is good, the wait is expected and normal the porridge is excellent the service is as expected for a spot lik this. We are regulars and love the nostalgia this place gives us. super authentic and very ethnic.

95xIqzOFavuML8HY863OQg.text: This place is OK. The food was OK. They do have a lot of Dim Sum choices to choose from. They have large round tables for big groups. Nothing remarkable here.

ZjDYqoBVydsiAxCPWlB8hw.text: We have been dining here since my daughters were very small.  I have experienced this place at its best, and at its worst. Their dim sum used to be the best and only game in town, but the lack of selection; and their inconsistent delivery method just becomes an annoyance.  Saturdays and Sundays, during lunch, can test one's patience in monumental proportion as far as food delivery is concerned. Couple that with the erratic service, it hasn't made for an enjoyable experience in years.  However, if you are on the west side, or go to GCU; there are no other good alternatives. Hence, the reason why even though they are actually dreadful; they still have no shortage of patrons that dine here.  Yes, I will agree that their food is good. But, what good is it, if it doesn't get to you in a timely manner.   I try to avoid dining here. However, since I have friends that either go to school @ GCU, or former employees that work there; and this is down the street from one of my paintball fields - I find myself eating here with great trepidation.   If they could fix the inconsistency of their service delivery, and dim sum / meal delivery; I could see this being high on my list again.   For now, it is just the middle of the road; due to the lack of options.

RAocfmcWq3dnC73OAknxbQ.text: I have gone here a few times.  I am from Los Angeles and am used to going to China town or a higher end on Beverly Blvd. near Beverly Hills.  This is good but not fabulous.  If you have a hankering for dim sum in Arizona, there aren't too many places.

sGt7DHWWPOpX9qEl9AQHHA.text: When you open a bun and there's a dead fly in your Food it's kind of a turnoff.  When the manager says "it happens" it's  a huge f-kc you.  I will not be returning.   A little customer service could have resolved the issue which was already bad.   Gross.

mZxPeT3hzUOAkBNBfwUn5Q.text: Over the years I've come to this restaurant for weekend dim sum brunch with friends and for celebratory banquets with a local Chinese-American organization, so I've been able to try a great variety of the food served here. There is a wide variety of dumplings and other steamed and fried delights at dim sum, and my only disappointment here is the roast pork belly - the skin lacks crunch and the dish itself tastes bland; all other dim sum selections are good to excellent.  For the banquets I've been very satisfied with the flavors, quantity, and presentation of the dishes. Service is hit and miss but the prices are good.

photos.caption: Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sweet and sour chicken
Photo of Great Wall Cuisine - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spicy green beans
